intro: Amaranthus angustifolius var. graecizans, commonly known as Greek amaranth, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems that can grow up to 1-2 meters in height. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a bluish-green hue due to the presence of a waxy coating. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in dense panicles, and the plant produces tiny, three-angled seeds. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional agriculture and cuisine.
